text: Politicians treat the opioid crisis like it's some new, intractable problem. It's not. 30 years ago, Congress passed a law to address the HIV/AIDS epidemic – and it worked. Yesterday was the 120th anniversary of the U.S. v. Wong Kim Ark, a landmark Supreme Court case that granted birthright citizenship to all persons born in America regardless of race or nationality. This Administration would do well to read up on this case. 
https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2015/08/31/donald-trump-meet-wong-kim-ark-the-chinese-american-cook-who-is-the-father-of-birthright-citizenship/?postshare=3341441046433404
